artwork.title: The Starry Night
artwork.description: The Starry Night is one of Van Gogh's most famous masterpieces, known for its swirling clouds and bright stars.

artwork.title: Guernica
artwork.description: Guernica is a powerful anti-war painting created by Picasso during the Spanish Civil War.

artwork.title: Mona Lisa
artwork.description: The Mona Lisa is perhaps the most famous portrait in the world, known for its enigmatic smile.

artwork.title: The Persistence of Memory
artwork.description: This surrealist masterpiece features melting clocks draped over various objects.

artwork.title: The Scream
artwork.description: The Scream depicts a figure with an agonized expression against a swirling sky.

artwork.title: The Night Watch
artwork.description: The Night Watch is a famous group portrait by Rembrandt, known for its use of light and shadow.

artwork.title: Les Demoiselles d'Avignon
artwork.description: This groundbreaking painting by Picasso depicts five nude women in a brothel setting.

artwork.title: The Last Supper
artwork.description: The Last Supper is a famous religious painting depicting the scene of Jesus' last meal with his disciples.

artwork.title: Water Lilies
artwork.description: Water Lilies is a series of Impressionist paintings by Monet, capturing the beauty of his garden pond.

artwork.title: The Mystical Nativity
artwork.description: This iconic Renaissance painting depicts the goddess Venus emerging from the sea.

artwork.title: Biyo Nolol(Water is Life)
artwork.description: In today’s Somalia, there are people who live on half a litre of water, or unable to get water at all.
